alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 10:02PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM MDT... At 1002 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bottomless Lakes State Park to 15 miles southeast of Tinnie. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts near 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Hagerman, Lake Arthur, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Sunset, Greenfield, Roswell Correctional Facility and Midway. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 79 and 104. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
